title: Dead Kennedys - Give Me Convenience or Give Me Death
description:
Give Me Convenience OR Give Me Death is an album by the Dead Kennedys. Its title is a play on the famous ultimatum by Patrick Henry, "Give me Liberty or Give Me Death!", and is intended as a commentary on American consumerism. The album is a compilation of several of the Dead Kennedys prior works. 15 of the 17 tracks were previously unreleased on any of their albums. The original vinyl version had tracks 16 and 17 on an extra flexi disc. The album was certified Gold by the RIAA in December 2007. This is the last Dead Kennedys album that Jello Biafra approved the production of as well as the last one on the Alternative Tentacles label.
